TopicTitle: cBBp SPC Pack v0.4: Fixed Failcan RCS and added some adapter pieces. Enjoy.

Articles.Content: Just impatient
If I had a nickel for every time I or someone I knew got impatient.... I\'d have a lot of nickels with nowhere to put them... ;P
I don\'t know if you have or not, but you should have a conversation with Nova. He might be able to help you work out the kinks.

I don\'t know if you have or not, but you should have a conversation with Nova. He might be able to help you work out the kinks.

no you are missing the point. the problem cannot be fixed by model or anything. it can only be fixed by harvester changing code. NovaS is not a damn god or anything that can help in anyway. His shuttle just has high Command pod control. the wings do very little. I am trying to do the opposite.
You don\'t need to use node attachments anyway, control surfaces with all 3 degrees of rotation if surface attached to another wing, I have configured and tested them myself.

You don\'t need to use node attachments anyway, control surfaces with all 3 degrees of rotation if surface attached to another wing, I have configured and tested them myself.

you just don\'t understand :/ they have to attach to an exact location or they look awful. I may try and do something about it one day but for now. it is canned.
I have decided to go back to my first Success. Engines.
Well shit. I was looking forward to the Kerbol-star as much as I was to the 0.14 update!

Well shit. I was looking forward to the Kerbol-star as much as I was to the 0.14 update!

we all were.

we all were...

but no worries it is not dead. Just taking a break. if nothing is done about it for 0.14 then i will fiddle with the hard way or making it work.
This is saddening.

This is saddening.

I get it - I\'ve got a bit of the same problem - the design I envisioned is just not possible yet. One can wait for the KSP to develop or alter the design. I guess CBBP just doesn\'t compromise And that\'s a good thing

I get it - I\'ve got a bit of the same problem - the design I envisioned is just not possible yet. One can wait for the KSP to develop or alter the design. I guess CBBP just doesn\'t compromise And that\'s a good thing

nope. I am OCD about my stuff
It\'s sad that you can\'t finish the shuttle yet because programming issues. But I\'m glad that you didn\'t gave up the project. Let\'s hope that the game\'ll able to handle your craft soon.
I see no reason why i would cancel it. I am not Lockmart.
going to be helping someone make Mir stuff. here is Sega Saturns sketch up stuff so far.

going to be helping someone make Mir stuff. here is Sega Saturns sketch up stuff so far.

If its the entire Mir, I can\'t wait to use it, as someone needs something to make multiple rundevous with.

decided to spend today on a facepunch Charity Item.

Jeb\'s Kerrari.
Question about your Mir: Do you plan on this being modular? When we get persistance and docking, I\'d really enjoy being able to launch and assemble this thing.
I\'m quite impressed with the current status of the Mir model.

Question about your Mir: Do you plan on this being modular? When we get persistance and docking, I\'d really enjoy being able to launch and assemble this thing.

no idea. I am not modeling it. Someone else it. but I would say that is the idea
Fresh from Sega Saturn.
-yawn- oh BTW Engine I have been working on is nearing it\'s final form.

Decided to change the name, because Kosmos is easier to say, and it sounds awesome if we call the space station pack the 'Cardboard Kosmos' Pack. Very Kerbal-ish if you ask me. I\'ll be continuing to model parts all weekend, and I\'ve decided on a final list of all the parts that will be in the pack:

--------

Salyut 4: Core, Docking Module, Solar Panel

Almaz: Core, Docking Module, Solar Panel

Mir: Core, Node, Kvant 1, Kvant 2, Kristall, Spektr, Docking Module, Priroda, Solar Panel, Radiator Panel, Small Radiator Panel, Sofora Girder

TKS: Functional Cargo Block (Fuel Tank), Engine, SAS, Nose RCS, Tail RCS, Capsule (!!!)

--------

I think that will give a well-rounded pack that allows for some pretty amazing space stations to be built. After this, I\'m not sure what to do next. I may someday recreate the Kliper Spaceplane, but I\'ll look into that later. In any case, Kosmos is off to a great start.
Engine Made and wrapped now to texture.
